I would recommend "Divergent" for those who enjoy action-packed dystopian stories.

For those who prefer a different genre, I would also recommend "Smilla' s Sense of Snow". This is a heartwarming and emotional story about a young Inuit girl named Smilla who has to survive in a harsh Arctic environment. 

Finally, if you are looking for an even more unique and captivating storytelling experience, then I would highly recommend checking out the movie titled "Little Fockers". This is a truly hilarious and entertaining film that follows the lives of three generations of wealthy and eccentric Fockers family.

In conclusion, there are many great movies available to watch. Some popular options include "Divergent", "Smilla' s Sense of Snow" and "Little Fockers". Whatever your preferences may be, I hope this list helps you find some new and exciting movies to watch!

Director Baz Luhrmann is known for his innovative approach to filmmaking, particularly in regards to the use of music and dance. The film stars David Wenham as Alvy Singer, Colleen Dewhurst as Annie Hall, Tracey Walter as a friend of Annie's, John Glover as Alvy's boss at the university, Diane Keaton as Alvy's wife and the owner of Moulin Rouge!, Jodi Benson as Alvy's daughter, Sam Lloyd as Alvy's son-in-law, Robin Williams as Alvy's best friend and former partner to Alvy's wife, Michelle Williams as Alvy's daughter-in-law. The film features a wide range of musical styles, including jazz, rockabilly, and even classical music. The film also includes several songs performed by the cast themselves. Overall, Moulin Rouge! is an innovative and memorable film that combines strong performances from its talented cast with an impressive array of musical styles and genres, ranging from jazz to classical music.
